intro: Calycolpus andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's calycolpus, is a rare tropical plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
